patient_information: Age: 71 years Sex: male Country of origin: Japan Comorbidities: none reported Immunosuppression: none reported Travel history: recent travel to Japan Allergy info: no allergy information provided
chief_complaint: Symptoms: nodule in the lung, eosinophilia Duration: 2 years
history_of_present_illness: Timeline: 2-year history of a nodule in the right lung detected during routine health check Key symptoms: chronic cough, haemoptysis, chest pain, fever, night sweats Severity pattern: progressive worsening over time
exposure_and_epidemiology: Residence travel: recent travel to Japan Vectors animals: no vector or animal exposure reported Water food risks: no water/food risks reported Contacts season outbreak: no sick contacts, no seasonal context provided Occupation: none reported
vitals: Temperature: normal Respiratory rate: normal Heart rate: normal Blood pressure: normal Oxygen saturation: normal
physical_exam: Chest exam: clear, no focal findings Abdominal exam: normal Neurological exam: normal Lymph nodes: no abnormality reported Other systems: no other significant findings
labs_and_diagnostics: Full blood count: {"WBC": "6.5 × 10^9/L (4–10)", "Hb": "15.3 g/dL (14–16)", "Platelets": "190 × 10^9/L (150–300)", "Neutrophils": "46.1% (30–80)", "Lymphocytes": "38.6% (15–50)", "Monocytes": "6.4% (1–12)", "Eosinophils": "8.3% (0–6)", "Total eosinophil count": "0.54 × 10^9/L (<0.45)"} Ige: 185.7 U/mL (<100) Serologies: {"Cryptococcus Ag": "negative", "Aspergillus Ag": "negative", "β-D-glucan": "6.0 pg/mL (<20 pg/mL)", "QuantiFERON test (QFT-2G)": "negative"} Imaging: {"chest_x-ray": "nodule in the right upper lobe", "CT_scan": "nodular lesion with increased FDG uptake", "FDG-PET-CT": "increased FDG uptake into the nodule"}
differential_diagnosis: Considered diseases: ["pulmonary tuberculosis", "lung cancer", "paragonimiasis"] Evidence for: ["nodular lesion with increased FDG uptake on PET-CT", "eosinophilia and elevated IgE levels", "recent travel to Japan"] Less likely diseases: ["pulmonary histoplasmosis, blastomycosis", "paracoccidioidomycosis", "other pulmonary infections"]
management_and_clinical_course: Treatment: oral praziquantel (25 mg/kg tds for 3 consecutive days) Response to treatment: lung lesion gradually faded and eventually disappeared Serum antibody titers: declined
final_diagnosis: Disease name: paragonimiasis Causative agent: Paragonimus westermani Confirmation method: multiple-dot ELISA strongly positive for P. westermani antigen Evidence for diagnosis: ["elevated IgE levels and eosinophilia", "recent travel to Japan", "nodular lesion with increased FDG uptake on PET-CT"] Alternative exclusions: ["pulmonary tuberculosis, lung cancer", "other pulmonary infections"]
